resources.string: If you have a fever of 100.4°F (38°C) or above, you should stay at home and get medical advice
Dry Cough follwed by shortness of breath or difficulty breathing or fever should be concerning
Headache as a complaint should not be ignored especially any new-onset headache
Chills with repeated shaking and loss of taste or smell and an overall lack of energy
These symptoms may appear 2-14 days \nafter exposure
Join the neighborhood watch for the era of COVID-19. Together, We can save lives.
Vui lập nhập thông tin hay gọi đường dây nóng
Có trường hơp tiếp xúc với trường hợp nghi ngờ nhiễm mắc bệnh hoặc đi từ vùng dịch về
